name: Lobster Mac and Cheese
headline: Lobster Mac and Cheese
description: For an elegant seafood dish, Ina Garten adds tender, buttery lobster and Gruy√Ø¬ø¬Ωre to her Lobster Mac and Cheese recipe from Barefoot Contessa on Food Network.

image.description: Description: Ina Garten's Lobster Mac and Cheese. Keywords: Cavatappi, Elbow Macaroni, Milk, Gruyere Cheese, Cheddar, Nutmeg, Lobster, White Bread.
Description: Ina Garten's Lobster Mac and Cheese. Keywords: Cavatappi, Elbow Macaroni, Milk, Gruyere Cheese, Cheddar, Nutmeg, Lobster, White Bread.
Description: Ina Garten's Lobster Mac and Cheese. Keywords: Cavatappi, Elbow Macaroni, Milk, Gruyere Cheese, Cheddar, Nutmeg, Lobster, White Bread.

keywords: Easy Pasta Recipes,Easy,Pasta Recipes,Easy Main Dish,Main Dish,Easy Lunch Recipes,Lunch,Macaroni and Cheese,Cheddar,Cheese,Gruyere Recipes,Parmesan Cheese Recipes,Lobster,Shellfish Recipes,Recipes for a Crowd
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 cups fresh white bread crumbs (5 slices, crusts removed)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Drizzle oil into a large pot of boiling salted water. Add the pasta and cook according to the directions on the package, 6 to 8 minutes. Drain well.

Meanwhile, heat the milk in a small saucepan, but don't boil it. In a large pot, melt 6 tablespoons of butter and add the flour. Cook over low heat for 2 minutes, stirring with a whisk. Still whisking, add the hot milk and cook for a minute or two more, until thickened and smooth. Off the heat, add the Gruyere, Cheddar, 1 tablespoon salt, the pepper, and nutmeg. Add the cooked macaroni and lobster and stir well. Place the mixture in 6 to 8 individual gratin dishes.

Melt the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter, combine them with the fresh bread crumbs, and sprinkle on the top. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes, or until the sauce is bubbly and the macaroni is browned on the top.

review.reviewBody: This is a great base I used pancetta instead of lobster (my only choice would have been frozen).  I love all of these recipes.
Wonderful! Used lobster tails
Made this with leftover lobster from a New Year‚Äôs Eve broil fest. Very rich and delicious. Definitely feeds a crowd.

I haven't even finished making this recipe and I can already tell you it's 5 stars. Simple. To the point. I was nervous on all the salt in the "batter" so I reserved some for the topping instead. To be continued...
Just love this recipe!  Have been using it for many years.  If I don‚Äôt have enough lobster, I use shrimp, crab, or any other seafood I have on hand!  Definitely use Gruy√®re and sharp cheddars.
Love it! ‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è
So. Good.

This is an awesome recipe. I just made it yesterday, and it was absolutely delicious. The Mac and cheese is cheesy, without having so much cheese in it that it ends up being stringy. The edges were bubbly, the top crunchy, and it was just generally really good! It makes a lot, so if you‚Äôre having a party or serving it for a holiday you will definitely have enough for at least 12 people! Or a few really hungry people! My family is really small, so next time I make this I will probably scale back the recipe. Thank you, Ina!

My 3rd time using this recipe and it never fails! Definitely will be my go-to recipe. My husband who is very particular is obsessed! I made for Thanksgiving and my MIL couldn‚Äôt stop raving about them. I made a few changes by adding of 1 pack of Boursin Garlic & Herb cheese, used panko instead of bread crumbs and used 1 cup of lobster stock  + 3 cups of milk.  I made the stock by boiling down the lobster shells. Chef‚Äôs kiss!
Loved it all the way ! Thankful

Outstanding. Gave 4 stars bc of modifications suggested and used.
Used 8oz pasta boiled in lobster broth, full sauce recipe , usec 3/4, froze the rest for a white pizza. Cheese used was 8oz Xtra sharp white cheddar, 8 oz trader Joe's provolone Asiago blend aprox 1 0z gorgonzola dolce and a big glug of sherry. Panko crumbs with a bit of Paprika for color. 1lb lobster meat..knuckle and claws. A perfect Christmas eve feast.

I used mini shells as my pasta and added in some crabmeat because I didn't have enough lobster. I also used half cheddar and half Asiago cheese, along with the gruyere. This recipe took a lot longer for me to make, but it was the first time I tried it, so I'm sure it'll be easier next time around. And there definitely will be a next time because this stuff is really yummy.

This adult Mac and cheese is very good. Serve immediately out of oven. It tends to dry and lose creaminess the longer it sits. It‚Äôs rich, the portions plentiful. Served with a lemon vinaigrette dressed salad. I tried two ways. After reading reviews. After I made the sauce I split in half. In one pan I added written spices. Other pan I did black pepper and old bay seafood seasoning. I added crab baked each separately.
I liked both. It‚Äôs a personal preference. I also added about a 1/4-1/2 cup of the water i cooked the lobster in. To the pasta to loosen it up like other reviewers stated.

Delicious Mac and cheese. We had leftovers so after refrigeration we formed Mac and cheese into balls, dipped in egg and milk, covered with 50/50 panko and plain bread crumbs and fried at 350 degrees until golden brown.  Creamy and decadent on the inside and slightly crunchy on the outside. My husband and boys loved it.
Best mac & cheese ever! I added lemon zest to my panko crust.

Don‚Äôt overthink the recipe. The joy is in the subtle, simple ingredients. I use nutmeg grinder, my favorite gadget.
Bought my steaks from The Beef Palace. Been in town over 60 years.
Made asparagus with lemon zest. Great wine and thought I just spent $100 pp at fancy steak house.
Thank you Ina. Added to my‚Äù Special Occasion‚Äù menu.

I gave this a five star rating because I love this mac & cheese, with or without lobster. I love lobster, but I will never do this again. It really didn‚Äôt add anything, in my opinion, to the mac & cheese so the lobster was a waste of money in my opinion. I sent some with my son to his work and while it was reheating in the microwave, my son‚Äòs boss came along and told him if he took it out of the microwave, and sprayed some air freshener and tossed it in the trash, he take him out to lunch. Apparently it smells really bad when it‚Äôs reheating.
This is a great recipe. Made a second one gluten free and it was great also.
Everyone that has tasted this Mac n Cheese loves it, with or without lobster or crab.

This is my go-to for parties on Cape Cod. Thank you, Ina. I just make two changes. I add lemon zest. And instead of bread crumbs, I use Ritz crackers - a new England staple for "baked stuffed lobster" here. This makes all of our guests happy! Thanks again.
Delicious!  Made as written and it was fabulous.
Delicious! Great with gruyere and nutmeg. I used buttered panko mixed with grated Parmesan Reggiano.
So creamy and delicious, I used a little less cheese.

Made half recipe tonight, even tho I had to get creative with the cheese. Did not have Gruyere, but did have left over Fontina & Cojito, so I used a combo of those two cheeses & Cheddar. Also used seafood bouillon cubes in the pasta water. Heard yummy sounds coming from my husband.

Awful‚Ä¶ made it for my friends and we all hated it. The cheese has no flavor. Needs to be stronger cheeses, some didn‚Äôt like the breadcrumbs either. Worst tasting food especially for the price of lobster. No flavor at all. Very disappointed.
i halved the recipe as I only had a lobster tail. ¬†Omitted the nutmeg and used smokey Guda and cheddar and no breadcrumbs on top....taste was perfect.

I made this yesterday for the second time and it was outstanding!¬† The 4 lobsters that I cooked didn't yield quite 1.5 lbs of meat, so I added some leftover sauteed shrimp.¬† I used 2 cups of heavy cream and 2 cups of whole milk, and added a little Old Bay seasoning and white pepper to the sauce. I also added some of the water I drained from the lobsters when I was picking them, probably about a 1 1/2 cups. This helped thin the sauce out a little, and added a delicate lobster flabvor throughout the dish.¬† The consistency was just right. Used seasoned panko bread crumbs on top.¬† Delicious!!

Family loved this dish. Instead of lobster we used bacon! The dish definitely needed more seasoning so that‚Äôs what we did. I understand not using as much seasoning so the lobster can stand out, but we needed it since we didn‚Äôt have the lobster to stand out. Seasoning we added were paprika, red pepper flakes, and a touch of chili powder. ü§åüèº
My husband absolutely loves this recipe!

Love the basics of this recipe. ¬†After reading all the reviews I decided to exchange out nutmeg for cinnamon (pinch), seafood flavoring, which has Old Bay. The crust o top consisted of crushed pistachios, and a sleeve of Ritz crackers. ¬†I blended the two together, and then added to to top. ¬†Wow. I also added 1.5 cups of 1% milk, and 1/2 cup of heavy cream to add thickness. ¬†WOW. What a great dish this is. ¬†It‚Äôs definitely a side dish because it‚Äôs heavy and rich.¬†
Outstanding. We all loved it including my guests. Didn't use the nutmeg. Personal choice. I don't care for ntmeg.

To save dishes, instead of individual shells or ramekins, I mixed all the ingredients in a large oven-friendly skillet (Blue Diamond is incredible), then transferred the entire skillet to the oven as a casserole. It worked magnificently. Family loved it. Also added a hint of cream sherry.
This was okay, I did not fond the nutmeg overpowering, but found the whole thing thing rather bland, needed something else, not sure what will try researching other recipes.¬†
DELICIOUS!!!!
Way too much nutmeg

I feel like I wasted a ton of lobster and good cheese. The nutmeg is entirely overpowering. I would make it again but omit the nutmeg, lessen the pasta or up the lobster, and bake it for less time or on a lower heat setting.
As always, Ina nailed it and made me look good! Delicious the first round and heated it up for several leftover rounds. This makes quite a bit for a side dish.
Best Lobstah Mac and Cheese I‚Äôve ever had!
Oh my gosh!  This recipe is delicious. I made it exactly as written. Thank you Ina!

Have made this many times. A requested family favorite. So easy and so good. I top mine with cornflakes instead of breadcrumbs. I add 3/4 of the noodles and then add a little at a time until just the right consistency to ensure that it is not too dry. Langostino is tasty in this recipe, also. Perfection!
I love this combo ‚ù§Ô∏è

This was my first time making lobster mac & cheese so I was a bit nervous. It came out fantastic though and my family loved it. This meal is sufficient on its own, but I served it with Caesar side salads. I used frozen lobster tails. I pulled the lobster off most of the shell and put bits of butter and garlic on top. Then, I broiled it and chopped it up once slightly cooled. This one is a keeper!
This recipes was way to pricy to execute and the end result was just okay.
Great recipe! Will not use bread crumbs next time. Thanks for a great recipe!
I had a lot of hopes for this recipe but felt that it was a little too dry :( Good taste but ingredients were pricy and it was just ok.¬†
Delicious recipe. I will definitely make it again even if I dont have lobster.

This was very good but I ended up using at least another cup of milk and cup of the pasta cooking water to keep it creamier. Added the lobster cold right before baking and it didn‚Äôt over cook. Didn‚Äôt use nutmeg as I don‚Äôt like it but maybe next time maybe add some sherry to the bechamel and a little tarragon and garlic to the breadcrumbs.¬†
‚ÄúIt was alright but to expensive‚Äù And even after the cost I still feel like something was missing. To complex for the result that was yielded.

I followed the recipe exactly, I even followed along with the video. The nutmeg flavor was way too overpowering. If I were to make this again, I would omit the nutmeg, use panko instead of breadcrumbs and use more cheese to make it creamier. Overall, I was disappointed.
I used 2lbs lobster which was decadent. 1.5 would also be excellent.

I followed the recipe mostly.. Here's what I would do differently.. I used a quart of heavy cream (totally recommend) and I reduced the flour to 1/3 cup but kept the butter the same.. Cheese is opinion.. If you like the bite of the box stuff then reduce the gruyere and add in a quality blue cheese maybe 1/2 cup.. Then don't add the Nutmeg.. I am not a bread crumb fan and this called for WAY too much bread crumb.. It was yummy despite some changes I would make.. This is very easy to customize
This was a very easy meal to make and absolutely delicious.
I thought this recipe was perfect in every way.¬† We used pasta shells instead of the suggested pasta shapes and added bacon to the breadcrumb topping.¬† This was an absolute home run recipe!
Deliciouso! Is all I can say such a marvelous recipe your going to want over and¬† over again!
It‚Äôs VERY rich and filling. I‚Äôd recommend using a little less cheese, more milk for a more creamy texture. It was a bit too heavy for mac n cheese. But overall very tasty.
My family enjoyed this and where we live fresh lobster is plentiful so it‚Äôs a nice dish to prepare instead of the usual steamed lobster dipped in melted butter.¬†

Made for my husband's birthday dinner - outstanding!! I'm not a fan of mac/cheese but this was awesome. Followed the recipe exactly but used prepared bread crumbs/panko and added a bit of parm. Overall, a hit!
Made this with non dairy ingredients and vegan lobster. It came out incredible. Thank you!

This recipe is the same as her simple mac /n cheese recipe and is excellent EXCEPT don't add more than a 1/3 of cup of flour unless you like it super thick and not gooey and delicious. The nutmeg is essential for that extra BING! The breaded top is absent the thin-sliced tomatoes which are laid over the top of a big pan of Mac with the bread crumbs baked on top.¬†

Mine turned out doughy. ¬†Too much flour? Couldn‚Äôt taste the cheese, came out gunky instead of cheesy for some reason.

Usually Ina‚Äôs recipes are spot on so very disappointed with this one.
Very tasty & easy to make
I really did not like this recipe and I had to force myself to eat the leftovers.¬† A recipe that uses over $50 of ingredients should be much better than how this turned out.
I have made this several times and everyone loves it.
My quest couldn't stop telling me how relishes this was.  "The best Mac and cheese ever"
The pasta ratio to cheese sauce and lobster is off.  It would be much better with half the pasta.  It was a disappointment and waste of money, as is.
So delicious and rich. Do not change a thing!

Delicious recipe! Followed exactly, except used a casserole dish and it turned out great, cooked 35 mins. I used imitation lobster - obviously would be better with real lobster. If I were to make it again, I would use salted butter. For me, just needed a little more salt to really have good flavor.
Everyone enjoyed and it made plenty!! Don‚Äôt be afraid to add even more lobster if you want it more seafood heavy

Very good and super easy to prepare. I made in one square copper pan to make it easier along with prepared lobster meat from Costco. I did enjoy it but I ended up putting tapatio on it to give it a lil kick.
Easy to follow and turned out delicious! I used Asiago cheese instead of gruyere, soooo good!
Another great one from Ina
This was just plain yummy.  After spending a lot of money on lobster and especially cheeses I had high expectations. It lived up to all of them.
Fantastic
Absolutely delicious.

Made this for Valentines Day and delivered it to 2 different families. The only change we made was to use 2 cups heavy wiping cream and 2 cups whole milk. Everyone said it was amazing and wanted the recipe. It was so delicious and rich and creamy. The bread crumbs on top are perfect!¬†
Easy to make, and the flavor stays perfect whether you eat it on the spot or freeze for leftovers. Be sure to plan for at least an hour in the oven at 450 after freezing!
This was delicious, I added a bit of Dijon along with the other spices and it was awesome

Came out amazing! I changed a couple of things like using 2% milk and I didn't use as much Gruyere cheese, I used more cheddar and I had a bag of shredded cheese (Mexican mix).¬† Looked great and tasted great!¬† Thanks!

Followed bit by bit and it was awful, the whole house hated it... not sure what the heck happened but I made sure to follow the directions. Never had mac this bad before and ¬†I've made homemade baked mac and it's delicious but this right here was a disappointment.
Followed exact recipe. So good. Hubby loved it

video.name: Ina's Lobster Mac and Cheese
video.description: How can mac and cheese get any better? Ina adds tender, buttery lobster.
